metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4330 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the HDF5 1.8.16 library's failure to check if the number of dimensions for an array read from the file is within the bounds of the space allocated for it, a heap-based buffer overflow will occur, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution. It was discovered that HDF5 incorrectly handled certain input files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1
hdf5-tools - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1
libhdf5-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1
libhdf5-cpp-11 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1
libhdf5-mpich-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1
libhdf5-openmpi-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1').
